page.title: 03Local History-Harborne
page.content: St.Peter's Anglican Church was built in the early 13th.century & enlarged in 1827 with the addition of a new south wing. The main body of the church was rebuilt in 1866 & three lychgates erected between 1868 & 1892. Harborne Hall was built in 1763 as a private house .It was used as a hospital during the 1st.World War caring for Belgian refugees & later, war wounded. It was then a preparatory school until 1925 when the land was sold for a golf course. It is now a convent. Queen's Park was opened on 5th Oct 1898 by the Lord Mayor of Birmingham to celebrate 60 years reign of Queen Victoria. Harborne Golf Club was begun in the early 1900's and the Municipal Course was opened in the 1950's. The Swimming Baths were opened in 1923 & the 'bus garage in 1926.
